metadata.title: CVE-2016-4804 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The read_boot function in boot.c in dosfstools before 4.0 allows attackersto cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted filesystem, whichtriggers a heap-based buffer overflow in the (1) read_fat function or anout-of-bounds heap read in (2) get_fat function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4804` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dosfstools - 3.0.26-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dosfstools package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.26-1ubuntu0.1').
